sen.j: 地租改正事務局（ちそかいせいじむしょく）とは、1875年3月24日－1881年6月30日に明治政府に設置された部局。
sen.e: The Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform is a bureau established (and functioned) in the Meiji Government from March 24, 1875 to June 30, 1881.
sen.cmt: 設置された→ establishだけではその後に続く継続された期間との表現のバランスが取れにくいと思いましたので、括弧内に機能した、と入れました。
sen.e: The Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform was a bureau established (and functioned) in the Meiji Government from March 24, 1875 to June 30, 1881.
sen.cmt: "()"内の不要なスペースを削除しました。過去形に変更しました。
sen.e: The Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform was a bureau established (and functioned) in the Meiji Government from March 24, 1875 to June 30, 1881.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 地租改正の事業統括を行った。
sen.e: It controlled the Land-Tax Reform project.
It dealt with the Land-Tax Reform project.
sen.cmt: controlled から、 dealt with と変更しました。
sen.e: It managed the Land-Tax Reform project.
sen.cmt: 原文に合わせて修正

sen.j: 1873年より、大蔵省租税寮を中心として地租改正の作業が本格的に進められていた。
sen.e: Since 1873, Land-Tax Bureau of the Ministry of Finance had been proceeding Land-Tax Reform in full-scale, but when the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was divided from Ministry of Finance and established as an independent ministry, the project got delayed due to the influence from so-called "sectionalism", as seen in one of the departments of the Ministry of Finance that dealt with land measurement being separated off to the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs.
Since 1873, Land-Tax Bureau of the Ministry of Finance had been proceeding Land-Tax Reform in full-scale.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since 1873, Land-Tax Bureau of the Ministry of Finance had been proceeding Land-Tax Reform in full-scale.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、同年11月に大蔵省から分離する形で内務省 (日本)が創設されたところ、土地の測量などを扱った部門が大蔵省から内務省に分離されるなど所謂「縦割り」の影響によって事業の停滞を招いた。
sen.e: However when the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was divided from Ministry of Finance and established as an independent ministry, the project got delayed due to the influence from so-called "sectionalism", as seen in one of the departments of the Ministry of Finance that dealt with land measurement being separated off to the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However when the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs was divided from Ministry of Finance and established as an independent ministry, the project got delayed due to the influence from so-called 'sectionalism,' as seen in one of the departments of the Ministry of Finance that dealt with land measurement being separated off to the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs.
sen.cmt: カンマの位置を調整 " " → ' '

sen.j: そこで、地租改正を一括して扱う専門部局を設置することとした。
sen.e: Therefore, it was decided to create a specialized bureau that deals with Land-Tax Reform collectively.
Therefore, it was decided to create a specialized bureau that deals with Land-Tax Reform collectively.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Therefore, it was decided to create a specialized bureau that deals with Land-Tax Reform collectively.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1875年、大蔵・内務両省からスタッフを集めて地租改正事務局が設置された。
sen.e: In 1875, the Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform was established with officials from the Ministry of Finance and the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs, and on April 29th, Toshimichi OKUBO, the Secretary of Interior, took office of Secretariat Director General, so did Shigenobu OKUMA, Minister of the Treasury, of Goyogakari (the person in charge of the command from Imperial Household Ministry -the second highest position), and Masayoshi MATSUKATA, Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury and the Head of Land Tax, of Chief of Secretariat.
In 1875, the Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform was established with officials from the Ministry of Finance and the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1875, the Secretariat of Land-Tax Reform was established with officials from the Ministry of Finance and the prewar Ministry of Home Affairs.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 4月29日に事務局総裁に内務卿大久保利通、御用掛（次席）に大蔵卿大隈重信が就任し、大蔵少輔兼租税頭松方正義が局長に就任した。
sen.e: On April 29th, Toshimichi OKUBO, the Secretary of Interior, took office as the Secretariat Director General, Shigenobu OKUMA, the Minister of the Treasury, took office as Goyogakari (the person in charge of the command from Imperial Household Ministry) (the second highest position), and Masayoshi MATSUKATA, who was a Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury and concurrently the Head of Land Tax, took office as Chief of Secretariat.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「御用掛（次席）に」が「御用掛（次席）から」という意味にとれる訳文になっているため、書き直しました。
sen.e: On April 29th, Toshimichi OKUBO, the Secretary of Interior, took office as the Secretariat Director General, Shigenobu OKUMA, the Minister of the Treasury, took office as Goyogakari (the person in charge of the command from Imperial Household Ministry) (the second highest position), and Masayoshi MATSUKATA, who was a Junior Assistant Minister of the Ministry of the Treasury and concurrently the Head of Land Tax, took office as Chief of Secretariat.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同局は地方当局に対して指示を出すとともに、地方当局からの問い合わせに答えた。
sen.e: The Secretariat commanded the provincial regulators, while also answering inquiries from them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Secretariat commanded the provincial regulators, as well as answering inquiries from them.
sen.cmt: while alsoから、as well asと変更しました。
sen.e: The Secretariat commanded the provincial regulators, as well as answering inquiries from them.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 更に職員を各地に派遣して、測量や地価算定の直接指揮・指導することによって地租改正事業の促進を図った。
sen.e: Moreover, it promoted the Land-Tax Reform project by dispatching officials to various parts of country and giving direct commands and instructions on survey and land value calculation.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Moreover, it promoted the Land-Tax Reform project by dispatching officials to various parts of country and giving direct commands and instructions on survey and land value calculation.
sen.cmt: 文中の不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Moreover, it promoted the Land-Tax Reform project by dispatching officials to various parts of country and giving direct commands and instructions on survey and land value calculation.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 1880年までには大半の土地の地租改正事業を終えて地租への切替を終えたことから1881年6月30日をもって廃止された。
sen.e: It was demolished on June 30, 1881 as the changeover to the Land-Tax (System) has been done after having completed the Land-Tax Reform project over most of the land by 1880.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処『地租への切替を終えたことから』の中の『地租』は税金そのものを指すものではなく地租制度だと理解しますので (system) を付記しました。
sen.e: The Land-Tax Reform project had been completed and changed to Land-Tax (System) in the most of the land by 1880; therefore it was demolished on June 30, 1881.
sen.cmt: "()"内の不要なスペースを削除しました。書き換えました。
sen.e: The Land-Tax Reform project had been completed and changed to Land-Tax (System) in most of the land by 1880; therefore it was demolished on June 30, 1881.
sen.cmt: the を削除

sen.j: 事実上の地租改正終了が宣言され、残務は大蔵省租税局（旧・租税寮）に継承された。
sen.e: The factual end of the Land-Tax Reform was declared, and the remaining work was taken over by Sozei-Kyoku (Land-Tax Bureau), (former Sozei-Ryo; Land-Tax Bureau).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: As the end of the Land-Tax Reform was declared, remaining works were taken over by Sozei-Kyoku (Land-Tax Bureau) (former Sozei-Ryo; Land-Tax Bureau).
sen.cmt: 書き換えました。
sen.e: As the end of the Land-Tax Reform was declared, remaining works were taken over by Sozei-Kyoku (Land-Tax Bureau) (former Sozei-Ryo; Land-Tax Bureau).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 残された一部の山林などでの作業も翌1882年までに完了した。
sen.e: The remaining work in some mountain forests was completed by the next year, 1882.
The remaining work in some mountains and forests were completed by the next year, 1882.
sen.cmt: 「山林」がmountain forestsとなっていますが、mountains and forestsです。
sen.e: The remaining work in some mountains and forests were completed by the next year, 1882.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
